N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 3.6 - Duties of the president

State Regulations
(a) The
president shall devote himself to the duties devolving upon him by statute and
the rules and resolutions of the Regents, to the encouragement and promotion of
education throughout the University and to the inspection of its several
institutions and departments, and shall make such recommendations to the

Regents as he may deem necessary or proper. In the absence of other officially
designated representatives of the Board of Regents, he shall represent the

Board of Regents and the University on ceremonial occasions in this and other
academic jurisdictions. (b) No
person may sign any agreement or contract on behalf of the University of the

State of New York except the president or a fiscal agent designated by him. A
contract, for the purpose of this paragraph, shall include a contract, a
memorandum of understanding, or any other written promise to pay money or incur
a financial obligation. Notes
